p: Aromatic natural oils are bio-generated via differentiated pathways in plants, fungi as well as some species of bacteria. Their main components belong to the highly variable family of natural products—terpenes—including derivatives of ketones, alcohols, phenols, esters and aldehydes. Over the last decade, volatile chemicals regained interest as sources of new antimicrobials and anticancer compounds. Although, they were mainly used against carcinogenic and bacterial infections, their potential anti-inflammatory, antioxidant and immunomodulatory are reasonably investigated [ 56, 67].
